page.title: 12TRANSPORT
page.content: The main road between Accrington, Church and Blackburn is the A679(T), more commonly known as "Blackburn Road". It used to be a "Turnpike Road", which is a road built or improved by a group of businessmen. In the late l8th/19th centuries it was no more than a dirt track, but the businessmen employed people such as John McAdam, to improve the quality of the road. Obviously, this venture was costly, so they charged tolls (fees) at the ends of the road. The money went to maintaining the road and probably a small profit! Evidence of the old Turnpike Road is at Intack, where there is a round building called the "Toll Bar Inn".{ {Railways} The East Lancashire railway system is a branch line. The local part starts at Preston and passes through stations
